item.title: Oil Jumps on Report Trump Is Less Confident on Deal With Iran
item.description: Oil prices rallied on a report that US President Donald Trump is growing less confident about securing a nuclear deal with OPEC member Iran.
item.dc:creator: Alex Longley, Paul Burkhardt

media:content.media:description: Liberty Lift Solutions LLC pumpjacks near Crane, Texas, US, on Saturday, March 15, 2025. The Permian Basin, a sprawling shale patch that lies beneath Texas and New Mexico, is North America's most prolific shale patch. Photographer: Justin Hamel/Bloomberg

item.title: Wall Street Watches as Fed Search Kicks Off
item.description: Traders say if Trump picks Powell’s replacement soon, it could lead to a “Shadow Fed.”
item.dc:creator: Simon Kennedy, Subrat Patnaik

item.title: What to Expect From the May US CPI Report
item.description: The US CPI report is expected to show core inflation up 0.3% in May as investors watch for signs of the trade war’s net impact on inflation. Michael McKee has a preview on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US, China Officials Agree on Plan That Awaits Xi, Trump Sign-Off
item.description: The US and China capped two days of high-stakes trade talks with a plan to revive the flow of sensitive goods — a framework now awaiting the blessing of Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Flatley, Annmarie Hordern

item.title: Hong Kong Funds Plan to Cut Treasuries If US Loses AAA Score
item.description: Hong Kong’s pension fund managers have formed a preliminary plan to sell down their Treasury holdings within as soon as three months if the US loses its last recognized top credit rating, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Echo Wong, Greg Ritchie

media:content.media:description: Source: Excerpt of JPMorgan Chase & Co. report on US holdings by country published on May 14

item.title: Tower Firm TDF’s Owners Said to Pick Banks for €10 Billion Sale
item.description: The owners of French towers company TDF Infrastructure including Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. have selected banks to help arrange the potential sale of the company, people familiar with the matter said, after previous attempts to do so failed to materialize.
item.dc:creator: Vinicy Chan

media:content.media:description: The TDF hertzian communication tower on the skyline in Paris.

item.title: Futures Dip on Thin US-China Trade Talk Outcomes: Markets Wrap
item.description: US stock futures slipped after the Trump administration’s trade talks with China ended with thinly detailed outcomes.
item.dc:creator: Andre Janse Van Vuuren, Allegra Catelli

item.title: AirAsia’s 100-Jet Paris Order Pits Airbus A220 Against Embraer
item.description: Low-cost carrier AirAsia is poised to order about 100 regional jets at the Paris Air Show next week, with the Malaysian airline still undecided between the Airbus SE A220 or Embraer SA’s E2, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Danny Lee, Siddharth Vikram Philip

media:content.media:description: Airbus A220 assembly. Photographer: Graham Hughes/Bloomberg

item.title: UniCredit’s Orcel Rules Out Commerzbank Bid at Current Price
item.description: UniCredit SpA Chief Executive Officer Andrea Orcel effectively ruled out making an offer for Commerzbank AG at the current price, saying such a move wouldn’t add value after a rally in the stock.
item.dc:creator: Sonia Sirletti, Antonio Vanuzzo

item.title: ECB’s Lane Says June Cut Helps Keep Price Undershoot Temporary
item.description: The European Central Bank’s latest reduction in borrowing costs will guard against inflation getting stuck below 2%, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.
item.dc:creator: Mark Schroers, Alexander Weber

item.title: Musk Backtracks on Trump, Says Posts 'Went Too Far'
item.description: Elon Musk, who served as a close adviser and confidant to President Donald Trump until a bitter public falling out last week in a series of social-media posts, issued his strongest sign of contrition yet over how he handled the rupture. "I regret some of my posts about President @realDonaldTrump last week," he said on his social-media platform, X. "They went too far." The dispute, which was triggered by Musk's opposition to the tax-cut bill Trump is pushing through Congress — posed a threat to Musk's wealth when the president raised the prospect of retaliating by cutting off his government contracts. That would have battered SpaceX, his rocket company, and Tesla Inc.'s stock price tumbled last Thursday, before recovering most of the loss. Bloomberg Anchor Tom Mackenzie joins Caroline Hepker and Valerie Tytel with the details. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Musk-Trump Feud Distracts Tesla Traders Ahead of Robotaxi Launch
item.description: After years of anticipation and broken promises, Tesla Inc. said its robotaxi service is tentatively set to roll out later this month. Options traders aren’t ready to buy the hype yet.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

item.title: Traders Boost Bets on Just One 2025 Fed Cut Ahead of CPI
item.description: Traders are increasingly betting that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates only once this year amid signs of resilient growth and sticky inflation.
item.dc:creator: Edward Bolingbroke

item.title: Soy Sauce Maker Foshan Haitian Starts Taking Orders for Up to $1.2 Billion Hong Kong Listing
item.description: Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food Co. began taking investor orders for a Hong Kong listing that could raise as much as HK$9.56 billion ($1.2 billion), the latest deal of its kind powering the city’s share-sale recovery this year.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian

media:content.media:description: Bottles of Foshan Haitian Flavoring & Food soy sauce in Beijing. Photographer: VCG/Getty Images

item.title: Tanzanian Currency Rises Most Since January
item.description: Tanzania’s shilling strengthened the most since mid January, paring one of the world’s biggest yearly losses.
item.dc:creator: Eric Ombok, Fumbuka Ng'Wanakilala

item.title: Adani Visits Chinese Equipment Makers as US Legal Woes Linger
item.description: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani traveled to China last week to meet industrial equipment manufacturers, marking what appears to be his first overseas trip since the US unveiled criminal and civil cases against him in November.
item.dc:creator: Anto Antony

item.title: Turkey Central Bank Seeks to Repel Short-Term Carry Trade Bets
item.description: Turkish policymakers are taking steps to deter so-called “hot money” flows into the lira, pushing back against one of the world’s most lucrative currency bets.
item.dc:creator: Kerim Karakaya, Beril Akman, Tugce Ozsoy

media:content.media:description: The Central Bank of Turkey, in Ankara.

item.title: Euro’s Steady Demand Shows Challenge of Taking On the Dollar
item.description: International use of the euro remained flat for another year in 2024, laying bare the depth of the task in challenging the US dollar on the global stage.
item.dc:creator: Mark Schroers

item.title: Chinese Stocks Advance as Preliminary Trade Deal Eases Tensions
item.description: Chinese stocks rose on Wednesday, after the world’s two largest economies agreed on a plan to reduce trade tensions following a two-day meeting in London.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Lin Zhu, Winnie Hsu

media:content.media:description: The Shanghai Financial Exchange Square, which houses the Shanghai Stock Exchange, China Financial Futures Exchange and the offices of the China Securities Depository and Clearing Corp., in Shanghai, China, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. Transactions in China's long-term sovereign bond futures are cooling as traders hold off making bets in the market given continued tariff disputes with the US. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: Indian Depository NSDL Is Said to Plan $400 Million IPO for July
item.description: National Securities Depository Ltd. is pressing ahead with its plan for an initial public offering that is expected to raise about $400 million, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi, Rajesh Mascarenhas, Dave Sebastian

media:content.media:description: A bell at the National Stock Exchange in Mumbai. Photographer: Abeer Khan/Bloomberg

item.title: Canada’s Former Finance Minister on Trump, Trade, China Ties
item.description: Canada should bolster ties with China to hedge against uncertainty from President Donald Trump’s approach to bilateral relations, according to Bill Morneau, the country's former finance minister. Morneau speaks with Erik Schatzker at the Bloomberg Invest conference in Hong Kong. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: European Gas Prices Rise as Hotter Weather Blankets Region
item.description: European natural gas prices reversed a three-day slide as above-normal temperatures started covering the continent, potentially driving up fuel use for air conditioning.
item.dc:creator: Anna Shiryaevskaya, Priscila Azevedo Rocha

item.title: Canada’s Ex-Minister Urges Better China Ties to Hedge US Risks
item.description: Canada should bolster ties with China to hedge against uncertainty from US President Donald Trump’s approach to bilateral relations, according to a former top Canadian official.
item.dc:creator: Katia Dmitrieva, Erik Schatzker

item.title: ECB’s Wage Tracker Signals Pay Growth Will Plunge This Year
item.description: Wage growth in the euro zone will slow sharply in 2025, according to the European Central Bank’s main gauge of future pay increases – bolstering arguments that inflation is under control.
item.dc:creator: Mark Schroers, Alexander Weber

item.title: European Power Surges on Fresh Fears of French Reactor Corrosion
item.description: Power prices across Europe jumped as nuclear giant Electricite de France SA reported signs of “stress corrosion” at a reactor, renewing fears that generation may be curtailed once again.
item.dc:creator: Eamon Farhat

media:content.media:description: The Civaux nuclear power plant in France.

item.title: Royal Air Maroc Set to Place Major Boeing, Airbus Aircraft Order
item.description: Royal Air Maroc is in the final stages of a major order from Boeing Co. and a smaller deal for Airbus SE jets as part of the North African carrier’s expansion plans, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Leen Al-Rashdan, Siddharth Vikram Philip, Julie Johnsson

media:content.media:description: A Royal Air Maroc 787-9 Dreamliner aircraft.

item.title: ECB’s Kazaks Says Some Fine-Tuning Rate Cuts ‘Quite Likely’
item.description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said further interest-rate cuts may be needed, according to Econostream Media.
item.dc:creator: Zoe Schneeweiss

item.title: AllianzGI CEO Sees Europe as Rival Haven to US
item.description: Allianz Global Investors CEO Tobias C. Pross shares his investment outlook in a conversation with Sonali Basak at the Bloomberg Invest conference in Hong Kong. Pross says European equities are “quite cheap” on a price-earnings basis, while US stocks have been overpriced. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mizuho Is Said to Be on Cusp of Buying Indian Investment Bank Avendus
item.description: Mizuho Financial Group Inc. is on the verge of buying a majority stake in investment bank Avendus Capital Pvt, people familiar with the matter said, in what would be the latest acquisition by a Japanese bank in India.
item.dc:creator: Baiju Kalesh, Manuel Baigorri, Hideki Suzuki

item.title: Falling Australian Iron Ore Grades Prompt Benchmark Proposal
item.description: The iron ore industry’s key pricing benchmark for seaborne cargoes could be lowered as the quality of supplies from biggest exporter Australia worsens.
item.dc:creator: Katharine Gemmell

media:content.media:description: Iron ore poured into a cargo ship at Rio Tinto Group's port facility in Karratha, Western Australia, on Friday, 20th Oct , 2023. Rio Tinto Group, BHP Group Ltd. and Fortescue Metals Group Ltd. produce almost two-thirds of the world’s seaborne iron ore from Western Australia, and margins remain enviable. For the first time in a generation, though, the specter of disruption looms over mining’s most reliable profit generator.
